title: Create compliance reports for Oracle LMS-managed products
content:
Oracle License Management Services (LMS) aim to help customers make the most of their Oracle investments in an effective and compliant manner. SAM supports creating compliance reports based on the license consumption data managed by Oracle LMS.

SAM supports Oracle database licensing in soft-partitioned environments such as VMware virtualization technology and hard-partitioned environments such as IBM LPAR virtualization technology. 

For VMware infrastructure discovery:

You need to configure WMware related discovery jobs to discover necessary infrastructure data and topology. See VMware - Universal Discovery Content Pack

For IBM LPAR infrastructure discovery:

You Need to configure IBM LPAR related discovery jobs to discover necessary infrastructure data and topology. See IBM Virtualization discovery - Universal Discovery Content Pack

To create compliance reports for Oracle database, follow these steps:

  1. Run Oracle LMS-related discovery jobs.
    Because no CIs of the Oracle Database options and management packs exist in UD/UCMDB, you can't retrieve license consumption information on the Oracle Database options and management packs when you synchronize the product family from UD/UCMDB. Before you trigger a synchronization job, run Oracle LMS-related discovery jobs, including Oracle LMS Data Collection by SQL and Oracle LMS CPU Data Collection by Shell, to extract the license consumption information from the LMS ZIP package in UD/UCMDB. The parsed data is then pushed into SAM to build a complete product family. Then, SAM can calculate Oracle Database license consumption.
    For more information on Oracle discovery, see the Universal Discovery for Oracle License Management Implementation Software section in Universal Discovery Content Pack online documentation. 
  2. Synchronize the product family.
  3. By default, SAM synchronizes the infrastructure information at midnight every day. To manually synchronize the infrastructure information from UCMDB, see Synchronize the infrastructure information. 
  4. Maintain license compatibility matrix based on the publisher's official documentation. 
  5. Configure license rules.
    Currently, SAM's license rules can only calculate the license consumption of on-premises Oracle LMS instances.
    For IBM LPAR virtual environment, make sure that the License processor cores in LPAR environment option under the Properties section is selected for the products of Oracle Database based on LMS.
  6. Configure license models to build license pool information. Separate software models are required for your database, database options, and management packs respectively.
    For more information, see Software coverage.
  7. Calculate license consumption.
  8. View compliance status.
    For Oracle running instances, that is, Oracle Database (Based on LMS), the value of the Number of versions field on the On-premises tab page by default includes Oracle Database running instances and all Oracle Database Options and Management Packs.
  9. Analyze compliance report.
